section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: All stations that are received are displayed.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, these may be AM, FM, or DAB stations.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, these may be AM or FM stations.

action-step.paragraph: The last station listened to will be played and the station list displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: An icon on the station that is played indicates if the station has already been stored.

section.title: Selecting a station manually
section.paragraph: Station selection via the frequency.

section.title: Track recognition
section.paragraph: If the vehicle is connected to a music service via Connected Music, you can, depending on the country, search for the track that is currently playing on the radio with your music service and, e.g., add it to your favorites.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: All stations that are received are displayed.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, these may be AM, FM, or DAB stations.
Depending on vehicle equipment and national-market version, these may be AM or FM stations.

action-step.paragraph: The last station listened to will be played and the station list displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: An icon on the station that is played indicates if the station has already been stored.

section.title: Selecting a station manually
section.paragraph: Station selection via the frequency.

section.title: Track recognition
section.paragraph: If the vehicle is connected to a music service via Connected Music, you can, depending on the country, search for the track that is currently playing on the radio with your music service and, e.g., add it to your favorites.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: HR Radio is a digital radio system that enables radio stations to transmit their broadcasts in a quality that is better than via analog signals.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on vehicle equipment, only analogue transmitters can be received.
When setting a station with a digital signal, it may take a few seconds before the station plays in digital quality.
In areas in which the station is not continuously received in digital mode, the playback switches between analog and digital reception. In this case, turn off digital radio reception.
The displayed names of these HD stations end with ...HD or...HD1.

In areas in which the station is not continuously received in digital mode, there may be interruptions of the audible signal lasting several seconds. The duration of the interruption depends on the reception.
The displayed names of these HD radio multicast stations end with ...HD2, ...HD3, ....

section.title: Turning digital radio reception on/off

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold the desired entry.

section.paragraph: icon is displayed with the station name when the sound signal is digital.

section.title: License conditions
section.paragraph: HD Radio Technology manufactured under license from iBiquity Digital Corporation. U. S. and Foreign Patents. HD Radio™ and the HD, HD Radio, and “Arc” logos are proprietary trademarks of iBiquity Digital Corp.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: DAB is a digital radio system that enables radio stations to transmit their broadcasts in better quality than via analog signals.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Stations can broadcast several shows simultaneously on one frequency via DAB. The collection of stations for a particular frequency is called an ensemble.

Depending on the programming offered by the station, additional information and images can be transmitted. Some stations broadcast special programs, e.g., sports stations can broadcast different sporting events at the same time.

action-step.paragraph: The last station listened to will be played and the station list displayed.
DAB: some information about the station and program being played is shown. Availability, content and sequence are set by the radio station.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: An icon on the highlighted channel indicates whether the channel has already been stored.

section.title: Automatic station following
section.paragraph: If reception is poor, the system looks for the same station in another ensemble. If the station can be received better in a different ensemble, it is automatically changed over.

With station following, the station is additionally searched for in the analog frequency range. If the station is not available in another ensemble, it is changed over to the analog frequency of that station. For this purpose, the corresponding station must be available in sufficient quality.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The provider can bundle stations in packages.

item.paragraph: The reception must be present. It is usually at its best when you have an unobstructed view of the sky.

action-step.paragraph: The phone number and identification number of the radio are displayed.
Call the phone number to have the channel enabled.
The phone number and identification number of the radio are displayed.
Call the phone number to cancel your subscription to the channel.
The last channel played will be played back and the channel list displayed.
Select the desired channel from the channel list.

section.title: Storing a channel
section.paragraph: The menu on the right indicates if a station has already been stored.

section.title: Delete channel from the storage list

action-step.paragraph: Select search word or the desired category.
The subscribed channels from a category are displayed.
If necessary, tap on a subcategory.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The channel you are currently listening to is stored in a buffer for up to an hour.

The stored audio track can be played with a delay following the live transmission. When the memory is full, the older titles are overwritten. The memory is cleared when a new channel is selected or when the vehicle is switched off.

section.title: Time shift forward/fast rewind
section.paragraph: Within the stored recording, it is possible to jump to any point in time.

section.title: Automatic time shift
section.paragraph: In the following events, the audio playback will be muted:

item.paragraph: Activation of the voice activation system.

section.paragraph: If "Automatic timeshift" is activated, the audio playback will be muted for the duration of the event and then continued.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Stations can be stored as favorites.
Favorites are transferred from the Sirius account. Changes to the favorites are stored in the Sirius account
If a stored favorite is selected, the current track will be played from the beginning.
The menu on the right indicates if the channel was already stored as a favorite.

entry.paragraph: Channel is not stored as a favorite.
Channel is already stored as a favorite.

action-step.paragraph: The channels that are stored as Favorites are displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Listener profiles can be used to organize notifications. One listener profile is always active.

action-step.paragraph: Enter the desired name for the listener profile.
The current listener profile name is displayed.
Enter the desired name for the listener profile.
The current listener profile name is displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Notifications can be selected for artists, titles, leagues and teams. A notification is briefly displayed on the control display when the desired content is played on a subscribed station.

section.title: Selecting notifications
section.paragraph: A notification can only be selected for currently played contents.

section.title: Displaying notifications
section.paragraph: Tap on the notification on the control display to switch to the displayed channel.
When the notification is no longer displayed, it can be opened for a certain period of time as follows:

action-step.paragraph: Drag the display bar at the upper edge of the display down.
Press and hold the desired entry.
The current listener profile is displayed.
Set a check mark to activate notifications for the current listener profile.
Remove the check mark to deactivate notifications for the current listener profile.
Press and hold the desired entry.
The current listener profile is displayed.

section.title: Automatic update
section.paragraph: About twice a year, "SiriusXM" performs an update of the channel names and positions. The update takes place automatically and may take several minutes.

item.paragraph: Reception is not available in some situations, such as under certain environmental influences or topographical conditions. The satellite radio has no influence on this.
Graphical contents may not be received under certain circumstances.
The signal may not be available in tunnels or underground garages next to tall buildings or near trees, mountains or other powerful sources of radio interference.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Up to 50 stations can be stored.

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold the desired station.
Shift the station to the desired position.
Press and hold the desired station.

section.title: Adjusting the volume
section.paragraph: At the beginning of every trip, the traffic report volume is adjusted to the entertainment volume.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The volume can be adjusted during the traffic report by turning the thumbwheel.
The volume can be adjusted during the traffic report by turning the button.

section.paragraph: The volume can only be reduced to such an extent that the traffic report is still well audible.
